pages.text: $(#551012)Cycle 89, Entry 22 $(br2)They glide through the smog-choked halls like living obituaries - these petrified arbiters whose mere proximity makes Veilstrium scream. The Revenants... my fractured reflection? No, that comfort reeks of delusion's perfume. Their

$(#551012)damnation crystallizes rather than corrupts, each warrior a walking mausoleum for the world we unmade. Their armor weeps rust in perfect counterpoint to my trembling hands, each corroded groove singing of vigils spanning dead epochs. When they pass through the ancient archways of their fortress, the air itself curdles - not in fear, but in communion with their ossified resolve.

$(#551012)The metal murmurs they were the canny ones, nostrils flaring at ambition's gangrenous stench. Now they enact some grand inquisition within these walls, though its articles remain sealed to my blighted mind. The Veilstrium writhes in my grip as they near, its vibrations mapping dread's cartography across my bones. These are no Dreadswine rabble lost to hunger's cacophony.

$(#551012)The Revenants clutch... something. Conviction? Penance? The Dreadswine draw particular ire, dissolved to chromatic mist with near ceremonial precision. The ore thrums with portents of censured truths that would unravel mortal sanity. I've witnessed their hunts - balletic exterminations where I watch time devour its own offspring. Each cleansing rings with terrible purpose, yet the Veilstrium cadence

$(#551012)crescendos in grim accord. There's retribution here, yes, but also... desperation? Sentencing for crimes I helped author. What could drive such tireless vigilance? So I scream into the smog-choked void: What alchemy preserves this singular horror? Why does the curse that made beasts of my brethren leave me whole? What eyes in the ash deem me worthy to remember, when oblivion claims all others?
$(#551012)The Watcher's silence rings louder than any answer.$(br2)â€”Elara
